pipeline_expression.py - analysis of expression data¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id: pipeline_vitaminD.py 2870 2010-03-03 10:20:29Z andreas $
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This pipeline predicts gene that are differentially expressed.

This pipeline uses the bioconductor package.

Usage¶

Type:

python <script_name>.py --help

for command line help.

Code¶

pipeline_expression.buildProbeset2Gene(infile, outfile)¶

build map relating a probeset to an ENSEMBL gene_id

pipeline_expression.importFromSeries(infiles, outfile)¶

import expression levels from a GEO series.

pipeline_expression.importCEL(infile, outfiles)¶

import CEL files.

pipeline_expression.estimateExpression(infiles, outfile)¶

estimate expression levels.

pipeline_expression.computeExpressionLevels(infiles, outfiles)¶

normalize data using gcrma libary.

output a file with the R object and another as human readable table.

pipeline_expression.importExpressionLevels(infiles, outfile)¶

import presence/absence data.

pipeline_expression.computePresenceCalls(infiles, outfile)¶

modified workflow from https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/bioconductor/2005-July/009758.html

Calculate MAS5 detection pvalues and Present/Marginal/Absent calls.

Note that this analysis only applies to 3’ arrays, but not for other arrays like HuGene. The simpleaffy package was designed to correct for 3’ bias due to the 7’ oligo dT primers used for building cDNAs. It requires PM and MM probes, which might not exist on other arrays.

pipeline_expression.importPresence(infile, outfile)¶

import presence/absence data.

pipeline_expression.computeDifferentialExpressionSAM(infile, outfile)¶

check for differential expression.

Probesets that are called absent in either control or treatment are removed.
